cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles ESE of Progreso, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest but forecast to turn north then north-northeast across the central Gulf, aiming for the southeast Louisiana–Mississippi coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near the mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City, LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are expected Wednesday afternoon with a chance of brief hurricane-force gusts as the center passes west of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Peak water levels of 4–6 ft above ground are possible along the Mississippi coast, including the Port of Pascagoula.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated totals up to 6 inches could cause flash or urban flooding at and near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes/waterspouts are possible Wednesday and Wednesday night; seas and swells will become rough, hampering vessel movements.
